full_summary:
# F5299-240004 Multibeam Survey - Georges Bank
=============================================

**Announcement**
---------------

The Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) is seeking a contractor to acquire and deliver processed multibeam bathymetric data for areas in the Gulf of Maine and Brown’s Bank. This requirement is related to Supply Arrangement F5129-210001/A and is by invite only.

**Requirement Overview**
------------------------

The selected contractor will be responsible for providing high-quality, processed multibeam bathymetric data for the specified areas. The data will be used to support the department's research and operational activities.

**Contract Details**
-------------------

*   **Contract Title**: F5299-240004 Multibeam Survey - Georges Bank
*   **Contracting Entity**: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
*   **Notice Date**: May 13, 2024
*   **Tender Closing Date**: June 7, 2024 at 14:00:00 EST
*   **Expected Contract Start Date**: June 3, 2024
*   **Expected Contract End Date**: None

**Eligibility Criteria**
------------------------

To be eligible to submit a bid, the contractor must be prequalified under Supply Arrangement F5129-210001/A. Interested contractors should contact the Contracting Authority for more information.

**Bid Submission**
-----------------

The Request for Proposal (RFP) documents and any requested information may be obtained on the GC Bid Solicitation Website at [link to be provided]. Bidders must submit their bids electronically in accordance with the instructions provided in the RFP document.

**Contact Information**
----------------------

Heather Walsh
Contracting Authority
Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, Quebec, K1A 0S5
Email: [heather.walsh@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:heather.walsh@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

**Important Information**
----------------------

*   This tender is subject to the terms and conditions of the Supply Arrangement F5129-210001/A.
*   The bidder must be prepared to demonstrate how their bid meets the selection criteria of Technical Merit and Price.
*   The bidder must also be prepared to sign a contract with the Crown.

**Note**: This announcement is for information purposes only and does not commit the government
